column4: Using asureus, on drapper, i get a warning saying that if i have a firewall please check to see if port 46761 UDP is open, this is a fresh install of drapper and I have installed no firewall, is there a firewall or such on by default?
Will - I am plugged right into the cable modem, no router
Dapper does not have a firewall enabled by default.
the command 'sudo iptables -L' in a shell will show you if you have some firewallrules enabled.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/15522 this is how my output looks, thats without any rules.
you had a router you said? which brand and modell?
Just wondering since some adslmodems are routers also with firewalls
i think it's installed as default.
'which update-alternatives' will show you where the binary is located.
oh, then it could be something with azuerus/java messing around with you probably.
aye there you got it, you need to use 'sudo update-alternatives' for it since it needs to be run using superuser priviligies
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Java and read the section "Selecting the default Java version"
hmm must be something messy then, works fine here.
i copied the section for you and put it there.
they are probably not installed then, not sure if you need them though.
